description: From dare say: dare (“to have enough courage (to do something)”) +‎ say.

verbs.description: daresay (third-person singular simple present daresays, present participle daresaying, simple past and past participle daresayed or daresaid)

entries.meaning: (intransitive, archaic, originally)  Chiefly in the form I daresay: to say something boldly; to affirm or assert.
(intransitive, by extension) Chiefly in the form I daresay: to venture to say (as the speaker believes something is likely to be the case); to think something probable; to presume.
examples: Are you going to stay up all night? I daresay that I am.
